thread.title: Delayed plane ride puts Michigan State behind for Michigan preparation
thread.title_full: Delayed plane ride puts Michigan State behind for Michigan preparation

author: freep.com
title: Delayed plane ride puts Michigan State behind for Michigan preparation
text:
MORE Mark Dantonio canceled his 6:30 p.m. Sunday teleconference, a weekly media availability for the Michigan State coach, because he and his team arrived at the football building less than 4 hours before it was supposed to begin.
And that was about 11 hours after originally scheduled, because mechanical issues with MSU's plane after Saturday's 31-24 win at Rutgers forced the Spartans to scramble for hotel rooms and stay another night.
Tack that on to the adversity that greets the Spartans (6-0, 2-0 Big Ten) at the beginning of Michigan week.
They lost three more starters to injury, with no word on center Jack Allen (ankle), running back Madre London (ankle) and cornerback Darian Hicks (head). They have ailments and questions in every phase of the game heading to No. 12 U-M (5-1, 2-0), which crushed Northwestern, 38-0.
The Spartans are dropping in the polls (from No. 4 to No. 7 in the AP, from No. 3 to No. 4 in the Amway Coaches Poll), for whatever that's worth. The Wolverines are favored, and the line immediately jumped to seven points, also for whatever that's worth.
Some national media already are billing the game as a program referendum of sorts â€” USA TODAY's Dan Wolken wrote Sunday: "If Michigan wins this game, effectively ending the Spartans' hopes of making the College Football Playoff, it may be years before Michigan State fans recover from the gut-punch."
Dantonio, whose program has won 32 of its past 35 games and is working on possibly his best recruiting class, will preview the U-M game Tuesday. Immediately after escaping Rutgers and before encountering the plane issues, he didn't want to delve into the matchup when asked.
"I'm gonna just delay that response right now and focus on the present, like I keep telling our football team," he said. "Focus on the present, get on the plane, get back home. Collect ourselves, look at the things we did well, look at the things we've got to get better at, make decisions, and we'll worry about our football team."
Contact Joe Rexrode: jrexrode@freepress.com. Follow him on Twitter @joerexrode . Check out his MSU blog at freep.com/heyjoe . Download our new Spartans Xtra app for free on Apple and Android devices!
DETROIT FREE PRESS
Sharp: MSU, short on crutches, won't use injuries as one
